I see one thing (that's not related to your dpkg errors) - the duplicate /etc/apt/sources.list entry - you can do 'sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list' and put a # in front of one of the lines with 'http://archive.canonical.com/ubuntu/ lucid/partner Packages'
regarding the other errors, have you tried 'sudo apt-get -f install' ?
(btw - I'm making lunch - if you're patient with a delay, I'm happy to help :-))
Not a problem at all, trying the command you suggested now
Yeah i'm getting the same errors when I did that as before.
try sudo apt-get --purge remove linux-image-2.6.32-24-generic python-pyatspi gnome-orca python-ubuntuone-client ubuntuone-client ubuntuone-client-gnome xulrunner-1.9.2
It seems to be removing ok, I'm guesing when its done run the command you said earlier?
if it removes without errors, try 'sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade'
It ran cleanly and I ran those commands, however none of the packages we removed attempted to even install now.

that's to be expected, probably.  You might do 'sudo apt-get install linux-image-2.6.32-24-generic python-pyatspi gnome-orca python-ubuntuone-client ubuntuone-client ubuntuone-client-gnome xulrunner-1.9.2' to get them back
trying that now, thank you for the help :)
